metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Descriptive Statistics is broken down into Tendency and Variability .
content.html: Descriptive Statistics is broken down into Tendency and Variability.

content.text: In statistics, the Variance is the average of the squared differences from the Mean Value .
content.html: In statistics, the Variance is the average of the squared differences from the Mean Value.

content.text: In other words, the variance describes how far a set of numbers is Spread Out from the mean (average) value.
content.html: In other words, the variance describes how far a set of numbers is Spread Out from the mean (average) value.

content.text: Mean value is described in the previous chapter.
content.html: Mean value is described in the previous chapter.

content.code_html:
// Calculate the Mean (m)
 let m = (7+8+8+9+9+9+10+11+14+14+15)/11;

// Calculate the Sum of Squares (ss)
 let ss = (7-m)**2 + (8-m)**2 + (8-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (10-m)**2 + (11-m)**2 + (14-m)**2 + (15-m)**2;

// Calculate the Variance
 let variance = ss / 11;

const values = [7,8,8,9,9,9,10,11,14,14,15];
let variance = math.variance(values, "uncorrected");

content.text: Standard Deviation is a measure of how spread out numbers are.
content.html: Standard Deviation is a measure of how spread out numbers are.

content.text: The symbol is σ (Greek letter sigma).
The formula is the √ variance (the square root of the variance).
content.html: The formula is the √ variance (the square root of the variance).

content.code_html:
// Calculate the Mean (m)
 let m = (7+8+8+9+9+9+10+11+14+15)/11;

// Calculate the Sum of Squares (ss)
 let ss = (7-m)**2 + (8-m)**2 + (8-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (10-m)**2 + (11-m)**2 + (14-m)**2 + (15-m)**2;

// Calculate the Variance
 let variance = ss / 11;

// Calculate the Standard Deviation
 let std = Math.sqrt(variance);

content.text: Deviation is a measure of Distance .
How far (on average), all values are from the Mean (the Middle).
content.html: How far (on average), all values are from the Mean (the Middle).

content.code_html:
const values = [7,8,8,9,9,9,9,10,11,14,15];
let std = math.std(values, "uncorrected");
